info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 03 at 12:59AM CDT by NWS Little Rock
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Stone, Independence, southern Izard, east central Van Buren, Cleburne, north central White and southwestern Sharp Counties through 130 AM CDT... At 1259 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Herpel to 10 miles west of Concord to near Quitman. Movement was east at 50 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Batesville... Heber Springs... Mountain View... Clinton... Fairfield Bay... Cave City... Greers Ferry... Cushman... Mount Pleasant... Pleasant Plains... Shirley... Concord... Magness... Sidney... Moorefield... Higden... Salado... Gid... Herpel... Sugar Loaf Recreation Area... MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 400 AM CDT for north central Arkansas.
